I just want to thank the Forum participants for making my Saturday quite nice. I am stuck by myself still recovering from Gall Bladder surgery and my wife is gone for a few days having to attend her fathers funeral. So today was made much more tolerable to me by this forum. The posts and debates were particualary interesting today and yesterday.
 
 Thanks all.

 wow....there is a real person under there. Good luck on your recovery, chemist.
All the best, mate. I enjoy reading your posts. emoticon_xhoho
Well, when I saw the title of this post I thought you were leaving the forum. Glad to see you're not. May your recovery be quick - my sympathy on the loss of your father-in-law.

I can empathize with you on the GB surgery....and what's to follow. If you had complete removal, the bile duct will eventually assume a portion of what the bladder used to do for you. Until then, you'll have to be really choosy about your intake.

My best wishes for your speedy recovery,
 Neil.
